sentence.Network_en: The team failed to qualify for the African Nations Cup finals.
sentence.Network_cn: 该队未能闯入非洲国家杯决赛。

sentence.Network_en: I would qualify that by putting it into context.
sentence.Network_cn: 我会将它放入上下文中进行具体解释。

sentence.Network_en: An expenditure for clothing will qualify as a trade or business expense.
sentence.Network_cn: 服装费将可算作贸易或商务开支。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'describe in a particular way'): from French qualifier, from medieval Latin qualificare, from Latin qualis 'of what kind, of such a kind' (see quality)

entry.tran: (通过考试)取得资格，合格，达到标准
entry.def: When someone qualifies, they pass the examinations that they need to be able to work in a particular profession.

example.ex: But when I'd qualified and started teaching it was a different story...
example.tran: 可是等我获得资格开始教书的时候，却是另一番情形了。

example.ex: I qualified as a doctor from London University over 30 years ago.
example.tran: 30多年前，我从伦敦大学毕业，取得了行医资格。

entry.def: If you qualify for something or if something qualifies you for it, you have the right to do it or have it.

example.ex: To qualify for maternity leave you must have worked for the same employer for two years...
example.tran: 你必须为同一个雇主工作满两年才能享受产假。

example.ex: The basic course does not qualify you to practise as a therapist.
example.tran: 这门基础课程并不能让你获得治疗师的从业资格。

entry.def: To qualify as something or to be qualified as something means to have all the features that are needed to be that thing.

example.ex: 13 percent of American households qualify as poor, says Mr. Mishel...
example.tran: 米歇尔先生说，13%的美国家庭符合贫困家庭的标准。

example.ex: These people seem to think that reading a few books on old age qualifies them as experts.
example.tran: 这些人似乎以为自己读了几本关于老年人的书就可以算作专家了。

entry.tran: 通过预赛;取得(下一轮)比赛资格
entry.def: If you qualify in a competition, you are successful in one part of it and go on to the next stage.

example.ex: Nottingham Forest qualified for the final by beating Tranmere on Tuesday...
example.tran: 诺丁汉森林队于星期二打败了特兰米尔队，取得了决赛资格。

example.ex: Cameroon have also qualified after beating Sierra Leone.
example.tran: 喀麦隆队击败塞拉利昂队之后也成功晋级。

entry.def: If you qualify a statement, you make it less strong or less general by adding a detail or explanation to it.

example.ex: I would qualify that by putting it into context.
example.tran: 我会将它放入上下文中进行具体解释。

means.word_mean: 1. prove capable or fit; meet requirements

sentences.sentence: "She was qualified to run the marathon"
"They nurses were qualified to administer the injections"
"Your education qualifies you for this job"

means.word_mean: 5. specify as a condition or requirement in a contract or agreement; make an express demand or provision in an agreement;

sentences.sentence: "The will stipulates that she can live in the house for the rest of her life"
"The contract stipulates the dates of the payments"

means.word_mean: 6. describe or portray the character or the qualities or peculiarities of;

sentences.sentence: "You can characterize his behavior as that of an egotist"
"This poem can be characterized as a lament for a dead lover"

means.word_mean: 7. add a modifier to a constituent

auth_sentence.content: Does not qualify for a more at risk category.
auth_sentence.res_content: Does not qualify for a more at risk category.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Does not qualify for a more at risk category.

auth_sentence.content: Saunders said it was a satisfying way to qualify.
auth_sentence.res_content: Saunders said it was a satisfying way to qualify.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Saunders said it was a satisfying way to qualify.

auth_sentence.content: Going there gives us a huge possibility to qualify.
auth_sentence.res_content: Going there gives us a huge possibility to qualify.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Going there gives us a huge possibility to qualify.

stems_affixes.word_buile: qualify[v.[使]具有资格, 证明合格, 限制修饰 v.限制, 限定]+ed表形容词→qualified有资格的
quality性质+ative表形容词→qualitative性质上的, 定性的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 资格, 条件, 限制, 限定, 赋予资格
stems_affixes.word_buile: qual某一种类,资格+ification表名词→n.资格, 条件, 限制, 限定, 赋予资格

stems_affixes.value_cn: 质量, 品质, 性质
stems_affixes.word_buile: qual某一种类,资格+ity表名词→n.质量, 品质, 性质

stems_affixes.value_cn: [使]具有资格, 证明合格, 限制修饰
stems_affixes.word_buile: qual某一种类,资格+ify表动词→v.[使]具有资格, 证明合格, 限制修饰 v.限制, 限定

Sentence.sentence: People have to receive higher education to qualify for a professional position.
Those who stay on for an additional two years can earn a master's degree that qualifies them as nurse practitioners (执业护士) or clinical nurse specialists.
Professor Robert Summers at Cornell Law School banned laptop computers from his thinks qualified lawyers need to possess a broad array of complex reasoning abilities.

Still, at the most selective schools, where thousands of candidates may submit identically high grades and test scores, a marginal item like the essay may serve as a tie-breaker between two equally qualified candidates.
Your gut reaction (本能反应) and dismissive rejection, even of a worthless idea, might not qualify as systematic or fair.

sentences.en: I won't qualify until next year.

sentences.cn: 这份证书证明产品合格。

sentences.en: His past experience qualified him to handle such a delicate matter.
sentences.cn: 他过去的经验使他有办法处理好这件微妙的事情。

sentences.en: I'd like to qualify my last statement.
sentences.cn: 我想修正一下最后一句话。

jushi.english: Did you take a degree at university before you qualified?
jushi.chinese: 在取得资格之前,你在大学里获得过学位吗?

jushi.english: I won't qualify until next year.
The power to regulate commerce could not be qualified.
jushi.chinese: 管制商业的权力不能削弱。
